intro: Schizanthus pinnatifidus, commonly known as the narrow-leaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its slender, pinnately divided leaves and vibrant, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from purple to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes other familiar plants like tomatoes and potatoes. Schizanthus pinnatifidus is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and can be grown as an annual or perennial depending on the climate.
